history.content:
If you're an undergrad, I think 194 is not generally not approval driven unless otherwise noted.

294 I think you need to get approval like any other grad-level course. It would be best to contact the professors for these courses.

----

In summary, you enroll in them the same way you would enroll in any other course.

----

It depends on the course, e.g. for CS 294-131 (deep learning) this semester, undergrads had to show basic familiarity with ML by providing their 188/189 grades, research/TA experience, etc.

If you're an undergrad, I think 194 is not generally not approval driven unless otherwise noted.

294 I think you need to get approval like any other grad-level course. It would be best to contact the professors for these courses.

----

In summary, you enroll in them the same way you would enroll in any other course.

If you're an undergrad, I think 194 is not generally not approval driven unless otherwise noted.

294 I think you need to get approval like any other grad-level course. It would be best to contact the professors for these courses.
Do I have to meet with professors personally?
history.subject: how to get approvals to take 194/294?
